text:
I opened the javadoc for log4j DOMConfiguration class and was interested at
looking at the log4j.dtd file. The javadoc contains a link to this file. The
link incorrectly points to an non-existing log4j.dtd page. The uri it uses is

http://jakarta.apache.org/log4j/docs/api/org/apache/log4j/xml/doc-files/log4j.dtd

Can someone make sure that the log4j.dtd file was copied to the web server or
that the link is corrected.

I have also noticed that the 1.2.8 distribution only includes the log4j.dtd 
within the log4j.jar file. It is not part of the javadocs.
creator: ccorsi@progress.com

text:
The top-level build.xml file "javadoc" target requires the following to be added:

  <copy file="${java.source.dir}/org/apache/log4j/xml/log4j.dtd"
        todir="${javadoc.dest}/org/apache/log4j/xml" />

The DOMConfiguration log4j.dtd link points to doc-files/log4j.dtd. The
doc-files directory does not exist within the org/apache/log4j/xml javadoc
directory. This will need to be changed to not include the doc-files.
creator: ccorsi@progress.com

text: *** Bug 27164 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The javadoc for several classes in both org.apache.log4j.xml and
org.apache.log4j.xml.examples refers to files in
docs/api/org/apache/log4j/xml/doc-files. The doc-files directory does not exist.
Some of the missing files from bug 27164 are now in
docs/api/org/apache/log4j/xml/examples while others don't appear to exist
anymore. All of the javadoc in these two packages needs to be checked for
consistency and the log4j.dtd file needs to be copied into place as Claudio
Corsi points out above.
